metadata.title: CVE-2021-29921 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In Python before 3,9,5, the ipaddress library mishandles leading zerocharacters in the octets of an IP address string. This (in some situations)allows attackers to bypass access control that is based on IP addresses.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29921` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.10 - 3.10.0~b1-2
libpython3.10 - 3.10.0~b1-2
libpython3.10-minimal - 3.10.0~b1-2
libpython3.10-stdlib - 3.10.0~b1-2
libpython3.10-testsuite - 3.10.0~b1-2
python3.10 - 3.10.0~b1-2
python3.10-examples - 3.10.0~b1-2
python3.10-full - 3.10.0~b1-2
python3.10-minimal - 3.10.0~b1-2
python3.10-venv - 3.10.0~b1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python3.10 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.10.0~b1-2').
